h3.a: College Credit Plus intent forms due May 1st

div.span: If you have a student who is currently in grades 6 through 11 who wishes to participate in the College Credit Plus Program next school year, the intent to participate form is due by May 1st. Forms can be emailed to Michelle Rippeth at the High School [email protected] or Leslie Salyer at the Middle School [email protected] The intent form can be downloaded using the following link Turning in the Intent to Participate form does not obligate the student to take classes through CCP, nor does it guarantee that they will be accepted to the university. The Intent to Participate form does not mean that you have applied for admission to the university. That is a separate application with separate deadlines. CCP Intent Form 2020-2021

h3.a: Ohio State Fair contest adds color and creativity to staying at home

span.p:
The Ohio State Fair is offering a family-friendly art opportunity for students and adults statewide with a special CRAFTED contest.
This competition offers Ohioans an opportunity to show off the amazing things they can create with found items in and around the home — such as paint, rocks, magazines, sticks, dried pasta, cotton balls and food containers.
Ohio teachers are invited to make the contest an art project for their students while remote learning. As a bonus, 10 random winners from each grade division (K-5, 6-8, 9-12 and college/adult) will win a VIP family four pack to attend the next Ohio State Fair, including one parking pass, four admission passes and four round-trip SkyGlider passes. Entering is simple! Post a photo of completed crafts on the appropriate Facebook post by June 1, 2020:

h3.a: Ohio Schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 School year.

div.span: The Vinton County Local School District will continue to be closed the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year per order of Governor Mike DeWine.

h3.a: The Vinton County Local Board of Education will hold their regular meeting on Monday, April 27 at 6:30 p.m.

span.span: The Vinton County Local Board of Education will hold their regular meeting on Monday, April 27 at 6:30 p.m. in the Vinton County High School cafetorium.

p.span: The Vinton County Local Board of Education will live stream the meeting and the public may view the meeting via Zoom. Meeting information will be made available here on the day of the meeting.

h3.a: Important Information Regarding Graduation, Ohio School Report Cards and PPE

table.style: border-collapse: collapse; color: #333333; font-family: Verdana, arial, Geneva, Helvetica, Century; font-size: 13.6px; background-color: #999999

p.style: text-align: center; line-height: 1.1; color: #000000; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 12px

img.alt: each child our future - in ohio, each child is challenged, prepared and empowered

h2.style: margin: 10px 0px; padding: 0.5em 0px 0px; font-size: 18px; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; line-height: 1.1

td.h2: Important Information Regarding Graduation, Ohio School Report Cards and PPE

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p: More informational documents have been posted to the Ohio Department of Education’s website today in light of the coronavirus-related school-building closure.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p:
Graduation
A new informational document has been made available to answer questions surrounding Graduation for Ohio students anticipating graduating from high school in the spring of 2020.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p:
Ohio School Report Cards
As schools navigate what the school-building closure order means for them, new information regarding Ohio School Report Cards and Accountability has been posted.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p:
Personal Protective Equipment and Necessary Items
Does your school have personal protective equipment (PPE) or other necessary items that could be used to help in the fight against coronavirus (COVID-19)? We ask all schools and districts to scour their storage spaces for any additional PPE or other items that could be used by medical caregivers.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p: Ohio urgently needs the following items:

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left

ol.li: Surgical gowns (S, M, L, XL, XXL)

li.style: margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left
margin: 0px 0px 7px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: left

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p: Many Ohio schools and career technical education centers already have sent such equipment to their local hospitals – and we are extremely proud of and grateful to them. This news also suggests that there may be other places where PPE exists, but that have not yet been identified and provided to our health care system.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p: Please thoroughly examine any possible locations where additional supplies may exist. If you identify any, please contact your local health department or nearest hospital or visit www.coronavirus.ohio.gov for instructions about where to donate it.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p: We will continue to provide updated information as it becomes available so please keep checking back at www.education.ohio.gov/coronavirus.

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

td.p: Thank you for all you are doing for Ohio’s students! Stay safe and stay home!

p.style: margin: 10px 0px; line-height: 1.4; font-family: arial, helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 14px

img.alt: ohio department of education - each child our future

h3.a: American Red Cross - needs local volunteers to help during COVID-19

p.style: text-size-adjust: auto; margin: 6px 0px 0px; color: #1c1e21; font-size: 14px; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; background-color: white

span.p: A quick community service announcement here (please share!!)... The American Red Cross is looking for local volunteers throughout Ohio that would be willing to help at blood drives and local disasters. In addition, we are also looking for 'HELP FROM HOME" volunteers to help with volunteer support. All required training and resources will be provided. For more info, send an email to [email protected]dcross.org or visit our volunteer website at www.redcross.org/volunteer .... Blood Donors are also needed in every area - visit redcrossblood.org to find the closest donation site near you to schedule an appointment! Thanks in advance for your consideration.

span.div: Click More + for a larger image.

h3.a: The Vinton County Local School District is accepting applications for Substitute Bus Drivers

div.span: The Vinton County Local School District is accepting applications for Substitute Bus Drivers with the possbiility of a full time route. We will provide the necessary training in order to obtain CDL and Bus licensure. Interested persons should contact Michael Ogier, Transportation Director at 740-596-4029 or Mike Waggoner, Assistant Superintendent at 740-596-5218.
The 2019-2020 District Calendar is available online for download at http://www.vinton.k12.oh.us/Downloads/19-20%20Calendar.pdf or Click More+ to view.

h3.a: Annual Athletic Parent Meeting Now on Video

span.div: Rather than trying to schedule and have all parents/guardians of athletes attend an annual meeting, this video has been created and added to the Athletic page of our district website. The video will be available for parents/guardians and athletes to view and review, if they have questions. Please click the following link, or go to the Athletic page of our site. Athletic Page

span.style: color: #272727; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; background-color: #ffffff

span.span: For the slideshows below, you can use the presentation menu to enter full screen mode, use the play button to start the slideshow, the arrow to advance slides manually or the dropdown box to select certain slides.

em.strong: We will provide diverse learners an academic and social roadmap to success.
We envision the Vinton County Local School District as having a united staff providing a comprehensive and meaningful education for all students.
